じゃ、シミュレーターで訓練するから。\nラウラはまず敵に慣れることからだしね！:
Well, I'll be training in the simulator.
Laura needs to get used to the enemy first!
はぁ～い♪ ラミちゃん、上手でえらいわ～♪\n小さいのに一生懸命で、ほんっとに可:
Okay~♪ Rami-chan, you're good at this~♪
She’s small, but she’s doing her best, and she really is cute...♡
やべ、マイクが入っていた。\nカメラを思いっきり睨んでいる。:
Crap, there's a microphone inside.
She's glaring at the camera as hard as she can.
ラウラは、小さい子を可愛がってしまう気質のようで、\n小さい体でよく動くラミを気:
Laura seemed to have the disposition to end up loving a little girl
She seems to have taken a liking to the lamia, which move well with her small body.
おそらくラミの話など、半分も届いていないだろう。\nどうする……？:
Most likely, not even half of what Rami had said had reached her.
What should we do...?
……じゃあ、ラミがいっぱい頑張れたら、\nあとでたくさんほめてくれる～……？:
...Then, if I can do my best with lots of lamies...
Will you praise me a lot later...?
うんっ、いっぱいよしよししてあげるわっ！\nお姉ちゃんが、ほめてあげる～っ！！:
Yeah, I'll do a lot of good things for you!
Onee-chan will praise you!!
でもでもぉ、お姉ちゃんの訓練だから、\nラミはお姉ちゃんがいいスコア出してくれる:
But, but, it's Onee-chan's training,
Rami said it'd be great if Onee-chan got a good score!
わかったわ！\nラミちゃんのためにっ、お姉ちゃんがんばるわっ！:
All right, all right!
I'll do my best for Rami-chan!
なるほど……新しいパターンの煽り方を覚えたな、あいつ。\nこら、キシシと笑うんじ:
I see... She's learned how to fan the flames of a new pattern.
Hey, don't giggle. They'll find out.
それじゃ～訓練始めるよ～！\nラミについてきて、お姉ちゃ～ん！:
All right, let's start training!
Follow Rami, Onee-chaaan!
……相性はいいのかもしれない。\nちゆるよ、この組み合わせ、もしかして楽しんでな:
...Maybe we're compatible.
Don't you think you're enjoying this combination?
そうしてメイズシフターとの戦闘が始まったのだが。: And so, the battle with the Maizsifter began.
いやぁ～っ！\nこっち来ないで、無理無理無理～っ！:
Nooooooo!
Don't come this way, I can't, I caaan't!
ラウラは怖がり、悲鳴を上げて逃げ回っている。\n一方ラミは前衛で平然と敵を倒し続:
Laura was terrified, running around screaming.
Rami, on the other hand, continued to calmly defeat the enemy in the vanguard.
シミュレーターでも、こんなに怖いのよ～！？\n本物と戦うなんて、無理よぉ～！:
Even in the simulator, it's this scary~!
It's impossible to fight the real thing!
なに甘えたこと言って……ごほんっ！！\nじゃなくて、えーっと……:
What a spoiled thing to say... Ahem!!
I mean, umm...
はっ！！ そうよね、お姉ちゃんが助けなきゃ！\n待っててラミちゃん、頑張って援護:
Hah!! That's right, Big Sis has to save her!
Hold on, Rami-chan! I'll do my best to support you!
……が、ラウラには効果てきめんらしい。\n銃身が震えていたが、必死な援護射撃で敵:
...But it doesn't seem to have any effect on Laura.
The barrel was trembling, but I fought off the enemy with desperate support fire.
お姉ちゃんすっごーい♡\nやればできるんじゃん、かっこいい～♪:
Onee-chan, you're amazing♡
You can do it if you try, can't you? So cool~♪
あ、ありがとラミちゃん。お姉ちゃん、頑張っちゃった！: Th-Thanks, Rami-chan. I did my best!
うんうん♪ ラミだけじゃなくて、\n仲間をみーんなを守れるお姉ちゃんなら、もっと:
Yep, yep♪ It wasn’t just Rami, either
If you’re a big sister who can protect her friends and everyone else, you’d be even cooler, you know?
見たいなぁ～♡ もっともっともーっと活躍する、\nつよつよお姉ちゃんをラミに見せ:
I wanna see it~♡ It's going to be even more exciting!
Show Rami your strong big sister~♡
というわけで、はい！ あと３セットいくよ～♪\nがーんばれっ、がーんばれっ♡:
Anyway, here we go! Three more sets~♪
Gaaaaahhhh, gaaaanbaaah! ♡
白目をむきながらも、ラミのためならば\nラウラは必死に訓練についていった……:
Her eyes rolled back in her head, but if it was for Rami’s sake
Laura desperately followed the training...
残るは心香。扱いが難しいと思ったのか、\n彼女にはちゆると白奈のふたりがついてい:
All that's left is Shinka. She must have thought it was hard to handle.
The two of them slowly joined her.
測定完了……基礎体力、全項目オールＡ。: Measure complete... Basic physical strength, all items A.
数値上のデータは完っ璧だなぁ。\n個人のパイロットとしては、即戦力だよね？:
The numerical data is perfect.
As an individual pilot, you're an immediate asset, aren't you?
うん、わたし達より操縦も戦闘も上かも。ちょっと悔しいくらい。: Yeah, she might be better at piloting and fighting than us. It's a little frustrating.
……でも、協調性がない。そう言いたいのよね？\nそう判断された結果、ここにいるわ:
...But they don't cooperate. That's what you're trying to say, right?
After all, she was here as a result of that decision.
どうして仲間へのフォローを嫌がるの？: Why don't you want to follow up with your friends?
嫌じゃないわ。ただ、必要ないと思っているだけよ。: It's not that I don't like it. I just think it's unnecessary.
私は、常に自分が最高のパフォーマンスを出せるよう、\n幼いころから鍛えてきたの。:
I always wanted to make sure I had the best performance possible.
I've been training since I was young.
陸上競技をやってた頃も、誰にも負けないよう強くなろうとした。\n私以上の努力をし:
Even back when I was playing track and field, I tried to get stronger so I wouldn’t lose to anyone.
All the lazy people who didn't put in more effort than I did fell for it.
要は自己責任。他人の自業自得の尻拭いをさせられるなんて、\nそんな理不尽、私は受:
The point is self-responsibility. To be forced to clean up someone else's messes...
I can't accept such unfairness.
それはパイロット科に入ってからも同じ。私ぐらいのことをやれば、\n必要最低限の能:
It's the same even after entering the pilot course. If you do something like me...
I've learned the bare minimum of ability. I don't think I need to follow up.
でもそうじゃないのは、怠けていたからよ。自分でやらかした分は、\n自分で賄ってほ:
But the reason I didn't is because I was lazy. I made up for what I did myself.
I just want to cover it myself. I don't want you to force the cost on me.
でも客観的に見れば、特別養成校舎にいる以上、\nキミも『やらかした』側じゃないか:
But objectively speaking, as long as she was in the special training building,
I think you're on the “I messed up” side, too. Do you understand that?
チームの大事さは理解しているわ。\nじゃないと大量のメイズシフターをさばけない。:
I understand the importance of the team.
Otherwise, I wouldn't be able to dodge a large number of maise shifters.
もし改善するのなら私じゃない。私程度の仕事もこなせない、\n他のメンバー達のマイ:
If you're going to improve, it's not me. You can't even do a job like mine,
The minds and skills of the other members.
その考え方はチームじゃなくて、ただの『寄せ集め』。\nパイロットは個人競技じゃな:
That way of thinking wasn’t a team, it was just a “massage.”
Pilots aren't individual competitions.
私は私にできることを他のみんなに求めているだけよ。\n結果も出してる。なのに、何:
I just want everyone else to do what I can.
I'm getting results. So what's wrong with that...?
ん……間違ってないよ。みんなが各々最高のパフォーマンスを\n引き出すことはとって:
Mm... You're not wrong. Everyone, have a great performance.
It's very important to draw it out.
その意識を持ってるだけ、あなたはあたし達よりも\nいいスタートを切れてるよ。:
You're just more conscious than we are.
You're off to a good start.
じゃあどうして……\nどうして私は、正式認定されないの！？:
Then why...?
Why am I not officially recognized!?
『それだけ』じゃチームとまでは呼べないからだね。\n白奈ちゃんの言う通り、せいぜ:
'That's all' isn't enough to call us a team.
Just like Hakuna-chan said, it's nothing more than a mishmash.
だからあなたは正式所属ができなかったの。: That's why you couldn't officially join.
みんなが最高のパフォーマンスを出すことは大事さ。\nでもね、『そのために自分はど:
It's important for everyone to put on their best performance.
But I don't know what I should do for that.
今は人任せにしている。自分で自分の面倒を見るのは義務で当然。\n自分にチームメイ:
Right now, I'm leaving it to someone else. It's my duty to take care of myself.
She said she wasn't responsible for her teammates.
だって、そのスタンスならもしチームで何かが上手くいかなくても、\n『悪いのは自分:
After all, with that stance, even if something didn't go well on the team,
I can say, “I’m not the one at fault here.”
チームワークとは、『味方に勝ってもらう』ことじゃない。\n『自分の力でチームを勝:
Teamwork didn’t mean “getting your allies to win.”
“It’s about letting the team win under your own power”—wait.
チームは、チームメイトの出す結果に無関係ではいられない。: A team can't stay unrelated to their teammates' results.
そ。自分が自分だけで出せる個人の力には限界があって、\nその限界を『最高』と呼ぶ:
That's right. There's a limit to the power of an individual who can do it on their own,
It's still a long way from calling that limit “the best”.
だから真に『最高』を引き出すには、『自分が仲間を勝利に導くんだ』\nとメンバーが:
That's why, in order to truly draw out “the best”, “you must lead your comrades to victory.”
That's what the members think, and we have to support each other.
そしてそのためには、強い信頼関係が必須。: And in order to do that, a strong relationship of trust is essential.
頼る、助ける。それだけじゃなくて、信じて託す。それが信頼。\nキミは正しいけど、:
Rely on her, save her. Not only that, but trust her. That's trust.
You're right, but I don't think that's enough to build a relationship of trust.
……私に、どうしろと？: ...What do you want me to do?
そうね……自分だけじゃなくて、\nまずは他の人の努力にも目を向けてみたら？:
That's right... It's not just me,
Why don't you look at other people's efforts first?
そんな抽象的なことを言われても、どうすればいいのか……: Even if you say something so abstract, I don't know what to do...
他人を減点方式じゃなくて、加点方式で見てあげるといいかもね。: It might be a good idea to look at someone else through the addition method, not the demerit method.
これができてないから減点、あれが不十分だから減点……\nそういう粗探しみたいな視:
Demerits because you can't do this. Demerities because you don't have enough points...
You can't forgive people if you look at them like they're searching for something, can you?
だからいいところも探そう？ 頑張ってる部分、できてる部分に\n加点していくように:
So let's look for a good spot too, okay? The part where you're working hard, the part that's made up.
The more points you add, the more you'll be able to see around you.
それと、あとは当事者意識があればいいと思う。\nパイロットとして以上に、プレ・ク:
Also, I think all that's left is to have a sense of involvement.
I hear you're even more of a Pre-Class-A member than you are as a pilot.
まあ、きっと大丈夫だって！ キミはストイックだから、\n目標を決めればそのために:
Well, I'm sure you'll be fine! You're stoic,
If you decide on a goal, you can do your best for it!
訓練が終わり、しばしの休憩時間になった。休憩用にした空き教室に、\nプレ・クラス:
The training ended, and it was time for a brief break. We went to the empty classroom we used for our break.
Julie, Laura, and Noel from Pre-Class-A were there.
ううう……頭が爆発するよ～……一生分勉強したあ……: Ugh... My head's going to explode... I've studied for the rest of my life...
よしよし。ジュリーちゃん、\nお姉ちゃんのお膝でゆっくり休んでていいからね。:
All right, all right. Julie,
You can rest in your big sister's lap.
なんかいつもより甘々だね！\nそれも訓練の成果？:
You're sweeter than usual!
Is that the result of your training?
そこへ、ぎこちない雰囲気の心香が、\n意を決したように入っていく。:
That's when I noticed the awkward atmosphere in Shinko's heart.
She made up her mind and went in.
……あの。今日の訓練の振り返り？\n私にも、聞かせて……くれない？:
...Um. Looking back on today's training?
Will you... let me hear it too?
普段の心香から考えると、意外なことなのだろう。\n３人はきょとんとして固まったが:
Considering her usual demeanor, it must have been unexpected.
The three of them froze, puzzled, but...
心香ちゃん、シミュレーターの撃墜数ランキングに\n名前が載ってたよ！ 今度、戦い:
Kokoroka-chan, you're in the simulator's shooting rankings.
There was a name on it! Next time, tell me how to fight!
そうだわ！ 心香って状況判断も鋭いし、\nコツとかあったら教えてよ！:
That's right! Kokoroka is a sharp judge of the situation,
Let me know if there's a trick or something!
ふふふ、心香ちゃんがひとりで頑張ってるの、\n私ずっとほめてあげたいと思ってたの:
Hehehe, Kokoro is working hard on her own,
I've always wanted to praise you♪
笑顔で迎え入れられた心香は、\n少し気まずそうにしながらも、どこか嬉しそうだった:
Shinka was greeted with a smile
She looked a little awkward, but there was something happy about it.
――俺がモニターするために待機していた別の空き教室に、\nシリウスシュガーのみん:
—In another empty classroom that I had been waiting for to monitor
Everyone from Sirius Sugaru came back.
おっ！ さっそく仲間の輪ができてるね～！: Oh! There's a circle of friends already!
お前達もいつの間にか、大した指導者だな。: Before I knew it, you've all become great leaders.
誰かさんに教わったことを、伝えただけですわ。: All I did was tell him what a certain someone had taught me.
マジか。いやーきっと素晴らしい指導者なんだな、\nその誰かさんって人は。よくお礼:
Seriously? Man, I'm sure he's a great leader,
That certain someone. Make sure to thank him often, okay?
ところがすっごいパワハラ野郎なんだよねー。: But he's a really powerful guy.
だから、反面教師にするとちょうどいいって……ちゆるが。: That's why, on the other hand, it's perfect for a teacher... Chiyuru.
ええとあの、私達はまずは相手を認めるところから始めようって、\n話になっただけで:
Um, well, we decided to start by acknowledging each other,
Just talking about it...!!
……ま、まあ、結果が出るなら、\n教え方なんて人それぞれでいいさ、なあ？:
...W-Well, if you get results,
Everyone can teach in their own way, right?
